Summary: Object spotted hovering high in place, then chases a commercial aircraft west into the distance
divs: sighting detailsbetween 6 and 7pm, saturday jun 28, 2008, under partly cloudy skies (no ceiling, blue sky, where no clouds present) i was looking north towards downtown houston from a point on the brazoria county side near the intersection of brazoria, fort bend and harris counties, tx, when i noticed a blurry silver\gray object high in the sky, against a clear blue sky. my first thought was it was a planet. the object appeared to hover back and forth, up and down slightly which quickly ruled out a planet. after watching it for a few moments i decided it was a bird, although at a height i could not estimate, nor had ever seen a bird fly at before. i was certain it was a bird. i had seen it dive at one point at which i thought i saw "white" or shiny, reflective bird shaped wings reflecting off the western evening sun. well at this point a fairly low flying southwest airlines 727 or 737 taking off from houston hobby airport heading west passed between myself and the object, i.e. the object was higher than the plane whose height i also could not estimate but high enough that i am not considered in an airport hazard zone, nor can i hear planes while i'm inside my house but they do take off and land in a pattern that takes them near my house under certain weather conditions. much to my surprise, the object seemed to come down towards the planes altitude and them chase it off in a westerly direction. it scared me to see what i was certain was a bird hovering almost in place suddenly accelerate to a planes speed. the object seemed to come down in a meandering but always smooth path, then meandered behind it maintaining speed with the plane. it then accelerated to a speed greater than the planes speed and took off in a straight line slightly northerly of the planes almost due west heading. not to an unreasonable speed, but greater than the 737's. i struggled with whether to report this and would accept an explanation that it was some sort of optical illusion but decided it best to report it in case anyone else might have seen something about that time as well.
